instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.A1502: What is A1502? A1502 is a model number for a 13 inch size MacBook Pro Retina from years Mid 2014, Late 2013, Early 2015 with EMC 2875, that may contain one of these boards depending on the year & configuration: 820-3476, 820-3536, 820-4924..
definitions.820-4924: What is 820-4924? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with weird graphics / display issues
threads.message:
Hey Guys, 

Working on <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with weird graphics / display issues. Graphics working well until login screen, after put password and login to desktop screen suddenly goes mosaic.

Plugging HDMI or DP to external monitor screen works normally and also recognizes the internal screen, when plugged off mosaic comes again.

Board pretty clean, no visual liquid damage.

[MEDIA=youtube]TbKa0JNwNnY[/MEDIA]

Diode mode readings:
<CAPACITOR>C8320</CAPACITOR> = 0.295
<CAPACITOR>C8321</CAPACITOR> = 0.296
<CAPACITOR>C8322</CAPACITOR> = 0.301
<CAPACITOR>C8323</CAPACITOR> = 0.297
<CAPACITOR>C8324</CAPACITOR> = 0.297
<CAPACITOR>C8325</CAPACITOR> = 0.296
<CAPACITOR>C8326</CAPACITOR> = 0.299
<CAPACITOR>C8327</CAPACITOR> = 0.300
<CAPACITOR>C8328</CAPACITOR> = 0.299
<CAPACITOR>C8329</CAPACITOR> = 0.297

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with weird graphics / display issues
threads.message:
There is no dedicated graphics.
Could be RAM, or CPU issue.
Do 2-3 times PRAM reset.
Next, try another LCD...

threads.title: <MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER>A1502</MACBOOK MODEL NUMBER> <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-4924</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> with weird graphics / display issues
threads.message:
Replacing LCD fix the issue.

Mr. Admin can mark this as solved.
Thanks
